channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why investors need to stop obsessing over when the Fed is going to cut interest rates next
item.description: Higher rates, in fact, can be positive for the stock market.

item.title: How Trump’s 50% copper tariffs threat could hurt America’s AI ambitions
item.description: The time required to bring new marginal copper production online is measured in years, not months, says CIO

item.title: This early-warning indicator is telling the stock market that a recession is more likely
item.description: If you’re like many U.S. consumers, you’re more worried now about money.

item.title: When my friend was on her deathbed, her parents took $25,000 in cash and won’t give it to her son. Do we tell him?
item.description: “They are a very religious family. These are the same people who hug the altar every week.”

item.title: Millions of Americans are about to see their student loans accrue interest again. Here’s what to know.
item.description: The Trump administration said borrowers enrolled in the SAVE program will see their balances grow, starting in August.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...
